channel.title: Yet another Portforwarding problem
channel.description:
Yes yes I know! Another!! Sorry but I have spent 2ish days on this one problem and its really getting me mad :P! Heres the deal. I have an Apple AirPort router that doesnt support port forwarding (It has all ports open) but my gateway (an Actiontec) has portforwarding options. In the past (someone helped me) I portforwarded on there. It worked last time so why not this time. Go figure. It doesn't. I portforward and click "Save and Restart" after the restart my ISP assigns me a new IP. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. So therefore the port is on the wrong IP everytime. Any ideas? Im running a 508 Bulby based off mezzy-scape if it matters. (Still in the works but I was looking to get the server stuff done)
Thanks in advance. Adecker246

@void_knight_master wrote:

get a linksystem router. easy to setup and easy to portforword.

item.title: Yet another Portforwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @cbo cbo
item.description:
@cbo wrote:

I also have one apple router and need help to port forward cause it doesnt seems to have a router page (i type in my dfault gateeway and says tht this page doesnt exist… etc…)
So or i keep one offline server (no fraking way) or I use a hamachi one (horrible srver ftw eh)
Well i cant evn log in at one offline server atm cause idk it says error conecting to server or it says that its offline, while im the new owner (the client isnt mine)

Read full topic

item.description:

Yes yes I know! Another!! Sorry but I have spent 2ish days on this one problem and its really getting me mad :P!
Heres the deal. I have an Apple AirPort router that doesnt support port forwarding (It has all ports open) but my gateway (an Actiontec) has portforwarding options. Im running a 508 Bulby based off mezzy-scape if it matters. (Still in the works but I was looking to get the server stuff done)
